tm_body:value:
The annual George Karpati Lecture commemorates a world-renowned neurologist and clinician-scientist who spent his entire extraordinary career at The Neuro.  George Karpati was respected for his great contributions to the diagnosis and treatment of neuromuscular diseases and for his research into the causes and possible cures for neuromuscular diseases, and especially muscular dystrophy.

This year’s lecture on May 17, 2016, entitled ‘Genes and mechanisms of mitochondrial neurodegeneration', will be delivered by Massimo Zeviani, Professor, The Clinical School at the University of Cambridge and Director of the MRC Mitochondrial Biology Unit, Cambridge, UK. The lecture begins at 4:00 pm in the De Grandpre Communications Centre of the Montreal Neurological Institute and Hospital (3801 University Street). A reception will follow.

This year’s lecture on May 17, 2016, entitled ‘Genes and mechanisms of mitochondrial neurodegeneration', will be delivered by Massimo Zeviani, Professor, The Clinical School at the University of Cambridge and Director of the MRC Mitochondrial Biology Unit, Cambridge, UK. neurodegenerative diseases

tm_body:value:
The 9th Annual Denis Melançon Neuroradiology Conference in Neuroradiology will take place on October 21, 2016. This annual conference was established to honour Dr. Melançon for his dedication to patient care and his commitment to training the next generation of neuroradiologists. The focus this year will be on the ‘Stroke’ with presentations by experts from The Neuro and McGill University beginning at 9:00. Our keynote talk, entitled ‘Keep Your Marbles: Vascular Dementia and a Plan to Prevent it’ will be delivered by Dr. Antoine Hakim, Professor of the University of Ottawa, Faculty of Medicine, Division of Neurology, Emeritus Professor, Ottawa Hospital Research Institute.

The Denis Melançon Neuroradiology Conference will take place at the Montreal Neurological Institute and Hospital, 3801 University Street, Montreal, Quebec in the Jeanne Timmins Amphitheatre.

We hope that you will join us to honour Dr. Melançon and to participate in this engaging scientific program. Registration is required by September 9, 2016 and is free of charge. To register visit www.neuroevents.mcgill.ca.mon
